STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 14, 2020
Mark Lambert
Good Will Farm Association Inc dba U.P. Kids
PO Box 428
Houghton, MI 49931
RE: License #: CB310282171
U.P. KIDS
P.O. Box 428
57 Huron Street
Houghton, MI 49931
Dear Mr. Lambert:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
08/12/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements and your
contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Courtney Atkins, Area Manager at (517) 599-3667.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12308 Application submission.
(1) An agency shall act on a completed and signed
application.
Two of 3 enrolled foster homes reviewed had application dates of 12/27/2018 and
10/17/2017. One file had an email from DCWL requesting revision dated
10/15/2019. The other enrolled file had a letter dated 01/25/2019 as the newest item
in the file.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed foster home files review did not have a copy of the foster
parent /agency agreement signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child
in a foster home, then both of the following shall be
documented before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up
to the time of the change in placement and the needs that
remain to be met.
One of two discharged foster care services files reviewed had a DHHS-69, but it was
not filled out with the required information.
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child
in a foster home, then both of the following shall be
documented before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
4

One of two discharged foster care services files reviewed had a DHHS-69, but it was
not filled out with the required information.
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Four of 7 services files reviewed had updated service plans which were not in the
required 90 calendar day timeframe. A total of six service plans were cited, one 14
days, one 10 days, two 2 days and two were 1 day beyond the requirement of the
above rule.
R 400.12708 Child evaluation.
(1) A social service worker shall complete a written
assessment of each child available for adoption within 60
days of the child being referred for adoption. The
assessment shall include all information available in the
foster care file from the date the child entered care and
shall meet all requirements of section 27 of 1939 PA 288,
MCL 710.27.
One of 3 child adoption file did not have the required assessment. The adoption
case was referred to the agency on 12/13/2019. The above rule requires that the
assessment be completed within 60 days.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
There were no additional MISEP violations.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
There were no additional DHHS Contract/Policy violations.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
5

No technical assistance was needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
No consultation was offered.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency was cited for the following at the interim inspection completed on
08/29/2019 with a CAP approved on 10/17/2019:
R 400.12306 Application request.
R 400.12310 Initial evaluation.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(i) A copy of all special evaluations completed during the last 2
years.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
SRM 200 FINGERPRINTS
Personnel Training
One policy violation
722-06H Page 6 of 12
Case Contacts
First Month Following Reunification and/or Placement with a
Respondent/Adjudicated Parent
Two MISEP Violations
4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22).
6

6.18 Relative Foster Parent Licensing, Timeliness (Commitment 54).
The only repeat violation is CPA 405(5) (a)(b).
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
August 14, 2020
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 14, 2020
